title: Lead Software Engineer
description: I joined a small startup called Convercent to help break down their aging monolith platform into the next generation of microservices. After about a year, i was given my own team to work purely on skunkworks projects. This was extremely fun as I was free to apply technology to solve problems within the company or pave way for new revenue.
achievements: Built a two-way SMS Conversation API
Perfected my microservice architecture leveraging composition root

title: Senior Software Engineer
achievements: Designed, Developed, and Deployed my own .net core microservice architecture and perfected my composition root pattern.

title: Senior Software Engineer
achievements: Google Maps Search API: RESTful service (webapi) for using Google Maps Geolocation
Generic Repository: Generic Repository that can use MongoDB or Entity Framework
Environment Monitor: Monitors environments as services are deployed to ensure stability

title: Software Engineer
description: A little startup out of Greenwood Village was really where I found my first mentor, Adam Berhle. I learned a lot here as a young dot net junior engineer with only a couple years under my belt building internal tools. This is where I would build my first product and production ready application. Numerous here as it turns out. This was my first taste of a company becoming my family.

title: Software Engineer
description: This is where I got my start. I applied online to a help desk position where I worked for 2 years before transitioning into a developer role. As a developer, I wrote tools to help the helpdesk become faster, more accurate, and more predictable. I got a lot of great experience and I am quite grateful for this job.
